titles.title: Whatsoever You Sow, That Shall You Also Reap

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Whatsoever you sow, that shall you also reap
This is eternal truth, there is no other way
If you sow to the flesh, you'll reap corruption
If you sow to the Spirit
You'll reap everlasting life
Every seed brings forth after it's kind
What you sow you reap.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Blessed are ye that sow beside all waters
Just faithfully do your part
And the harvest will come up behind you
He that goeth forth and weepeth
Bearing precious seed
Shall doubtless return again rejoicing
Bringing his sheaves with him.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
God is a farmer, He planted a garden
The invisible things of Him
Are there quite clearly seen
For the whole creation is a revelation
Of the spiritual principles of Father God
And the most important principle of all
Is what you sow you reap.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
Beloved, be not deceived; God is not mocked
He is giving us an incorruptible seed
And because He's giving us that kind of seed
He intends to bring forth that kind of life
For every seed brings forth after its kind.
What you sow you reap.
